intro: Herschelia newdigateae, commonly known as the Newdigate's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough, hairy texture, and it produces small, spiny buds that develop into fluffy, white to pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Herschelia newdigateae is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
